001package org.apache.juneau.marshaller;

014
015import java.io.*;
016import java.lang.reflect.*;
017import java.nio.charset.*;
018
019import org.apache.juneau.*;
020import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
022
023/**
024 * Top-level class for a pairing of a {@link Serializer} and {@link Parser} into a single class with convenience read/write methods.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 *    The general idea is to combine a single serializer and parser inside a simplified API for reading and writing POJOs.
028 *
029 * <h5 class='figure'>Examples:</h5>
030 * <p class='bjava'>
031 *    <jc>// Using instance.</jc>
032 *    Marshaller <jv>json</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Json();
033 *    MyPojo <jv>myPojo</jv> = <jv>json</jv>.read(<jv>string</jv>, MyPojo.<jk>class</jk>);
034 *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>json</jv>.write(<jv>myPojo</jv>);
035 * </p>
036 * <p class='bjava'>
037 * <jc>// Using DEFAULT instance.</jc>
038 *    MyPojo <jv>myPojo</jv> = Json.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.read(<jv>string</jv>, MyPojo.<jk>class</jk>);
039 *    String <jv>string</jv> = Json.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.write(<jv>myPojo</jv>);
040 * </p>
041 *
042 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
043 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshallers">Marshallers</a>
044 * </ul>
045 */
046public abstract class Marshaller {
047
048   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
049   // Instance
050   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
051
052   private final Serializer s;
053   private final Parser p;
054
055   /**
056    * Constructor.
057    *
058    * @param s
059    *    The serializer to use for serializing output.
060    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
061    * @param p
062    *    The parser to use for parsing input.
063    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
064    */
065   protected Marshaller(Serializer s, Parser p) {
066      this.s = s;
067      this.p = p;
068   }
069
070   /**
071    * Returns the serializer associated with this marshaller.
072    *
073    * @return The serializer associated with this marshaller.
074    */
075   public Serializer getSerializer() {
076      return s;
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Returns the parser associated with this marshaller.
081    *
082    * @return The parser associated with this marshaller.
083    */
084   public Parser getParser() {
085      return p;
086   }
087
088   /**
089    * Serializes a POJO to the specified output stream or writer.
090    *
091    * <p>
092    * Equivalent to calling <c>serializer.createSession().serialize(o, output);</c>
093    *
094    * @param object The object to serialize.
095    * @param output
096    *    The output object.
097    *    <br>Character-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
098    *    <ul>
099    *       <li>{@link Writer}
100    *       <li>{@link OutputStream} - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
101    *       <li>{@link File} - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
102    *       <li>{@link StringBuilder} - Output will be written to the specified string builder.
103    *    </ul>
104    *    <br>Stream-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
105    *    <ul>
106    *       <li>{@link OutputStream}
107    *       <li>{@link File}
108    *    </ul>
109    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
110    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
111    */
112   public final void write(Object object, Object output) throws SerializeException, IOException {
113      s.serialize(object, output);
114   }
115
116   /**
117    * Parses input into the specified object type.
118    *
119    * <p>
120    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
121    *
122    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
123    * <p class='bjava'>
124    *    Marshaller <jv>marshaller</jv> = Json.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
125    *
126    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
127    *    List <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
128    *
129    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
130    *    List <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
131    *
132    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
133    *    List <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
134    *
135    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
136    *    Map <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
137    *
138    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
139    *    Map <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
140    * </p>
141    *
142    * <p>
143    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
144    *
145    * <p>
146    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
147    *
148    * <p>
149    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
150    *
151    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
152    *    <li class='note'>
153    *       Use the {@link #read(Object, Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
154    * </ul>
155    *
156    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
157    * @param input
158    *    The input.
159    *    <br>Character-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
160    *    <ul>
161    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
162    *       <li>{@link Reader}
163    *       <li>{@link CharSequence}
164    *       <li>{@link InputStream} containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
165    *          {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
166    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code> containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
167    *          {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
168    *       <li>{@link File} containing system encoded text (or charset defined by
169    *          {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser.Builder#fileCharset(Charset)} property value).
170    *    </ul>
171    *    <br>Stream-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
172    *    <ul>
173    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
174    *       <li>{@link InputStream}
175    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
176    *       <li>{@link File}
177    *       <li>{@link CharSequence} containing encoded bytes according to the {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.InputStreamParser.Builder#binaryFormat(BinaryFormat)} setting.
178    *    </ul>
179    * @param type
180    *    The object type to create.
181    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
182    * @param args
183    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
184    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
185    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
186    * @return The parsed object.
187    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
188    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
189    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Type,Type...) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
190    */
191   public final <T> T read(Object input, Type type, Type...args) throws ParseException, IOException {
192      return p.parse(input, type, args);
193   }
194
195   /**
196    * Same as {@link #read(Object, Type, Type...)} except optimized for a non-parameterized class.
197    *
198    * <p>
199    * This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.
200    *
201    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
202    * <p class='bjava'>
203    *    Marshaller <jv>marshaller</jv>  = Json.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
204    *
205    *    <jc>// Parse into a string.</jc>
206    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
207    *
208    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean.</jc>
209    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
210    *
211    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean array.</jc>
212    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
213    *
214    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of objects.</jc>
215    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
216    *
217    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of object keys/values.</jc>
218    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>marshaller</jv> .read(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
219    * </p>
220    *
221    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
222    * @param input
223    *    The input.
224    *    <br>Character-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
225    *    <ul>
226    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
227    *       <li>{@link Reader}
228    *       <li>{@link CharSequence}
229    *       <li>{@link InputStream} containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
230    *          {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
231    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code> containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
232    *          {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
233    *       <li>{@link File} containing system encoded text (or charset defined by
234    *          {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser.Builder#fileCharset(Charset)} property value).
235    *    </ul>
236    *    <br>Stream-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
237    *    <ul>
238    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
239    *       <li>{@link InputStream}
240    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
241    *       <li>{@link File}
242    *       <li>{@link CharSequence} containing encoded bytes according to the {@link org.apache.juneau.parser.InputStreamParser.Builder#binaryFormat(BinaryFormat)} setting.
243    *    </ul>
244    * @param type The object type to create.
245    * @return The parsed object.
246    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
247    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
248    */
249   public final <T> T read(Object input, Class<T> type) throws ParseException, IOException {
250      return p.parse(input, type);
251   }
252}
